content:
StructureChangedEventArgs Class

In this Article

Contains information about the event that is raised when the UI Automation tree structure has changed.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class StructureChangedEventArgs : System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventArgs

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • EventArgs
  • System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventArgs
  • StructureChangedEventArgs

Inherited Members

Empty
,

,

,

Constructors summary

StructureChangedEventArgs(StructureChangeType,Int32[])

Initializes a new instance of the stem.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs.StructureChangeType* class, specifying the type of change and the identifier (ID) of the element whose structure changed.

Properties summary

StructureChangeType

Gets a value indicating the type of change that occurred in the UI Automation tree structure.

Methods summary

GetRuntimeId()

Retrieves the UI Automation runtime identifier (ID) of the UI Automation element whose structure changed.

Constructors

  • StructureChangedEventArgs(StructureChangeType,Int32[])

    Initializes a new instance of the stem.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs.StructureChangeType* class, specifying the type of change and the identifier (ID) of the element whose structure changed.

    public StructureChangedEventArgs (System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType structureChangeType, int[] runtimeId);

    Parameters

    • structureChangeType
      StructureChangeType

      A single value that specifies the type of change.

    • runtimeId
      Int32[]

      The runtime identifier (ID) of the UI Automation element whose structure changed. See Remarks.

    Remarks

    The values that can be returned in structureChangeType depend on the implementation of the UI Automation provider. For example, when items are added to or removed from a Win32 list box, if the provider is not able to determine the number of items added or removed, it might specify StructureChangeType and not StructureChangeType or StructureChangeType.

    The following table describes the information in the event received by the StructureChangedEventHandler for different structure changes.

    structureChangeType Event source runtimeId
    StructureChangeType The child that was added. The child that was added.
    StructureChangeType The parent of the child that was removed. The child that was removed.
    StructureChangeType The parent of the children that were added. The parent of the children that were added.
    StructureChangeType The parent of the children that were removed. The parent of the children that were removed.
    StructureChangeType The parent of the children that were invalidated. The parent of the children that were invalidated

    Custom controls might not be able to provide a meaningful value in runtimeId. For more information, see RaiseStructureChangedEvent.

    Example

    The following example shows how to construct and raise an event when children are added to, or removed from, a custom list box. 

    ''' <summary>
''' Responds to an addition to the UI Automation tree structure by raising an event.
''' </summary>
''' <param name="list">
''' The list to which the item was added.
''' </param>
''' <remarks>
''' For the runtime Id of the item, pass 0 because the provider cannot know
''' what its actual runtime Id is.
''' </remarks>
Public Shared Sub OnStructureChangeAdd(ByVal list As CustomListControl)
    If AutomationInteropProvider.ClientsAreListening Then
        Dim fakeRuntimeId(1) As Integer
        fakeRuntimeId(0) = 0
        Dim args As New StructureChangedEventArgs( _
            StructureChangeType.ChildrenBulkAdded, fakeRuntimeId)
        AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseStructureChangedEvent( _
            CType(list.Provider, IRawElementProviderSimple), args)
    End If

End Sub 'OnStructureChangeAdd


''' <summary>
''' Responds to a removal from the UI Automation tree structure by raising an event.
''' </summary>
''' <param name="list">
''' The list from which the item was removed.
''' </param>
''' <remarks>
''' For the runtime Id of the list, pass 0 because the provider cannot know
''' what its actual runtime ID is.
''' </remarks>
Public Shared Sub OnStructureChangeRemove(ByVal list As CustomListControl)
    If AutomationInteropProvider.ClientsAreListening Then
        Dim fakeRuntimeId(1) As Integer
        fakeRuntimeId(0) = 0
        Dim args As New StructureChangedEventArgs( _
            StructureChangeType.ChildrenBulkRemoved, fakeRuntimeId)
        AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseStructureChangedEvent( _
            CType(list.Provider, IRawElementProviderSimple), args)
    End If

End Sub 'OnStructureChangeRemove

    /// <summary>
/// Responds to an addition to the UI Automation tree structure by raising an event.
/// </summary>
/// <param name="list">
/// The list to which the item was added.
/// </param>
/// <remarks>
/// For the runtime Id of the item, pass 0 because the provider cannot know
/// what its actual runtime Id is.
/// </remarks>
public static void OnStructureChangeAdd(CustomListControl list)
{
    if (AutomationInteropProvider.ClientsAreListening)
    {
        int[] fakeRuntimeId = { 0 };
        StructureChangedEventArgs args =
            new StructureChangedEventArgs(StructureChangeType.ChildrenBulkAdded, 
            fakeRuntimeId);
        AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseStructureChangedEvent(
            (IRawElementProviderSimple)list.Provider, args);
    }
}

/// <summary>
/// Responds to a removal from the UI Automation tree structure 
/// by raising an event.
/// </summary>
/// <param name="list">
/// The list from which the item was removed.
/// </param>
/// <remarks>
/// For the runtime Id of the list, pass 0 because the provider cannot know
/// what its actual runtime ID is.
/// </remarks>
public static void OnStructureChangeRemove(CustomListControl list)
{
    if (AutomationInteropProvider.ClientsAreListening)
    {
        int[] fakeRuntimeId = { 0 };
        StructureChangedEventArgs args =
            new StructureChangedEventArgs(StructureChangeType.ChildrenBulkRemoved, 
            fakeRuntimeId);
        AutomationInteropProvider.RaiseStructureChangedEvent(
            (IRawElementProviderSimple)list.Provider, args);
    }
}

Properties

  • StructureChangeType

    Gets a value indicating the type of change that occurred in the UI Automation tree structure.

    public System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType StructureChangeType { get; }

    Property Value

    • StructureChangeType

      The type of changed that occurred.

Methods

  • GetRuntimeId()

    Retrieves the UI Automation runtime identifier (ID) of the UI Automation element whose structure changed.

    public int[] GetRuntimeId ();

    Returns

    • Int32[]

      The runtime ID of the UI Automation element whose structure changed.

    Remarks

    The return value may be the identifier of the child that was added or removed or, in the case of many children being added, removed, or invalidated, the identifier of the parent. For more information, see StructureChangedEventArgs.

    Custom controls might not provide a valid runtime identifier.
